contentrichtext.text: {{about|a mountain on Snæfellsnes|a Vestmannaeyjar volcano of the same name|Helgafell (volcano)}} {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox mountain | name = Helgafell | photo = Helgafell í Helgafellssveit 0460.jpg | photo_caption = | elevation_m = 73 | elevation_ref = | prominence_m = | prominence_ref= | listing = | location = {{flag|Iceland}} | range = | map = Iceland |relief=1 | map_caption = | map_size = 200 | label_position = right | lat_d = 65.0426 | lat_m = | lat_s = | lat_NS = N | long_d= 22.7279 | long_m= | long_s= | long_EW= W | coordinates_ref = | type = | age = | last_eruption = | first_ascent = | easiest_route = }} '''Helgafell''' ("holy mountain") is a small mountain on the [[Snæfellsnes]] Peninsula of [[Iceland]]. The mountain is {{Convert|73|m|ft|sigfig=3}} high, and a temple in honor of [[Thor|Þór]] was built there by the first settler of the area, Þórólfr Mostrarskegg. Helgafell also appears in the [[Laxdaela saga]] as the location where the heroine [[Guðrún Ósvífrsdóttir]] last lived and is supposedly where she is buried. [[Category:Mountains of Iceland]] {{Iceland-geo-stub}} [[fr:Helgafell]] [[nl:Helgafell]]
